intro: Persoonia oxycoccoides var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved geebung, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in heathlands and open forests. It is often found in regions of Western Australia and is adapted to dry, nutrient-poor environments. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
